docs.text: for many people , procrastination isn't a problem to overcome , it's a high art .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we'll do just about anything to put off a task .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when the deadline for this column nears , it's the only time during the week dishes get washed and the bed made and laundry done and plants watered and . . .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: eventually , hopefully , sometimes , there's a breakthrough and we actually get down to work .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: amazingly it's almost always easier than we dreaded and after finishing , that sense of oppressive apprehension melts away .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and then , the next time , we do it all again .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: english professor grady tripp ( michael douglas ) is a master .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: seven years ago , his first book was a hit .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he's been working on his second -- a short 200-page piece -- since then .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: fearful that he can't live up to the first , he can't bring himself to finish it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: no writer's block , he's nearing 3 , 000 pages with no end in sight .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: now he's having a particularly difficult day .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the college's annual writers conference is bringing in accomplished novelists reminding tripp that other people are finishing _their_ books .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: during the first day , his wife has left him , his married girlfriend informs him she's pregnant and his agent is in town with a six-foot transvestite in tow .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: by the evening , our besieged writer is driving though the snow-covered streets of pittsburgh with a suicidal student beside him , a stolen jacket that marilyn monroe wore on her wedding day in the back seat and a murdered blind dog stuffed in the trunk .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this could be a pivotal point in his mid-life crisis .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and then there's the next morning .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there's a lot to like about this movie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there are no huge explosions , shattering glass or computer-generated dinosaurs to distract from the very real human issues .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: grady is caught up in the curse of people who accomplish great things early in their career .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in the world of " what have you done for me lately ? " , he knows his second book has to be better than his first .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: instead of finding out , he drifts , comfortable in the insular cocoon of academic peter panhood .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he doesn't have much of a life and neither does his star pupil james leer ( tobey maguire ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: james may be suicidal and psychotic .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: certainly everything that comes out of his mouth is a lie .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he makes up a past of working clash anguish because the truth of wealth and comfort just isn't interesting enough .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as the weekend progresses , they are both forced to fully engage life .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that's the question they must face : comfort or real experiences ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film takes some interesting chances .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: non-traditional relationships are presented as matter-of-fact .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: extra-marital , gay , interracial , professor-student : here they aren't judged , merely choices .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the actors are all first-rate .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: douglas triumphs , playing against type as he spends most of his time disheveled , unshaven and clad in a pink women's house robe .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: maguire's disengaged alienation works perfectly here .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: robert downey jr . as grady's agent livens up his scenes .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: director curtis hanson ( " l . a .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: confidential " ) makes a few missteps .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the women are underused .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: frances mcdormand does a good job of her limited role of sara , grady's married lover but we never understand much of who she is .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the chemistry between the two of them is non-existent which makes some of the ending unconvincing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: katie holmes is a student with a major crush on the professor , but her character goes nowhere .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we never even see grady's exiting wife .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is very much a guy's film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the varied relationships between the men are much more convincing than any of the others .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: grady's alternating mentoring and rejection of james is the centerpoint of the film , not him and sara .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as the boomers age , expect to see more mid-life crisis films to catch the attention of that demographic .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: eventually it'll probably become cliche , but right now we've got a winner .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i'll finish this in a second .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: right now i have to grab some paint .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i noticed some trim in the other room that needs a little touch-up .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ( michael redman has written this column for so long that he's made mid-life crisis a career choice . )
docs.label: positive
